comment.author: 13267298@N00
comment._content: Kametaro Iijima, Japan's Consul General. Elsewhere: www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/3681843135/ On Wikipedia: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kametaro_Iijima

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Newly appointed in 1913, he arrived in U. S. in June to oppose the California Alien Land Law of 1913.

comment.author: 40147761@N04
comment._content: Just in case no one has said, or not said it lately. I want to Thank You guys for all the research you do. It makes the photos so much more interesting when the related info is handy. Keep up the good work !

comment.realname: lifeasdaddy ...a guy, his wife, and their son...
comment.author: 13267298@N00
comment._content:
Ah, thanks for your thanks Mona.  

I find it lots of fun to eke out these nuggets of information from the bygone age of 1905 - 1920.  It's one of my hobbies.

You can dive in and help too.

comment.author: 40147761@N04
comment._content: You are quite welcome. It is just so nice at my age (or any) to be able to click the link and learn more. I believe you're never too old to learn.  I might help a little. You guys seem to have a good handle on it. Wystan has me hooked on looking for dates that are almost invisable in this batch. Guggenheim is giving my old eyes fits.
